wikipedia_page.main: Sir Peter Drummond Macdonald KBE (1 February 1894 – 2 December 1961) was a Canadian-born Conservative Party politician in the United Kingdom. He was Member of Parliament (MP) for the Isle of Wight from 1924 to 1959.

response: Son of Harold Frederick Woodnutt, he was educated at Isleworth Grammar School.Dod's Parliamentary Companion, 136th year, Dod's Parliamentary Companion Ltd, 1968, p. 526 His younger brother was the actor John Woodnutt.Diaries 1969-1977, Peter Nichols, Nick Hern Books, 2000, p. 53 Woodnutt became involved in local politics on the island when he was elected to the Isle of Wight County Council to represent Bembridge. He later became a county alderman. He was selected by the Conservatives as their parliamentary candidate when the sitting Member of Parliament (MP) for the Isle of Wight, Sir Peter Macdonald, stood down at the 1959 general election. Woodnutt held the seat for the party, retaining it at the 1964, 1966 and 1970 elections.
* Peter Macdonald (Canadian politician) (1835–1923), Canadian Liberal MP for Huron East, Ontario, first elected in 1887
* Peter Macdonald (Conservative politician) (1895–1961), MP for the Isle of Wight (1924–1959)
* Peter Macdonald (Australian politician) (born 1943), former Mayor of Manly; former independent member of New South Wales Legislative Assembly for Manly

On December of 1933, Lady Jean remarried at a London register office to a Captain Peter MacdonaldLiverpool Echo - Thursday 14 December 1933 - Page 9 where she lived the remaining of her life with until her death in 1955.
